page.title: 13Events
page.content: Cwmaman Hall was brought into being by the voluntary action of those who worked and lived in the tiny mining village of Cwmaman in the 1880's. The hall was opened in March 1892 by Henry Austin Bruce, Lord Aberdare.Four years later the hall was totally destroyed by fire. Rebuilding was quick and on the day of Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee, 10th July 1897 the hall and institute were reopened. During the golden era of the hall, it was the home to a host of clubs, teams and societies but unfortunately today all this has been whittled down. The library, silver band and theatre still exist but everything is on a smaller scale. Today the hall is used for the purpose for which it was built, this provides finance for renovation to be carried out.
